learning_objective: Design and iteratively develop computational artifacts for practical intent, personal expression, or to address a societal issue by using events to initiate instructions.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is creating an online system to help their fellow students plan, apply and select the right college. Alex's idea is to make the system interactive and engaging by initiating certain instructions when a user hovers over or clicks on different universities in a map. Which of the following is the best approach for Alex to take?",
    "Answer1": "Create a static map with all universities and list details next to the map. When a user hovers over a university, use programming to highlight the university's name in the list.",
    "Answer2": "Create a map with clickable universities. When a user hovers over a university, display a pop-up with basic details. When a user clicks, guide them to a detailed page about the university.",
    "Answer3": "Develop a single page with a list of all universities. When a user clicks on a university's name, redirect them to the university's official website.",
    "Answer4": "Create an interactive map where users can hover over universities to see their names. However, do not include any other details or clickable functions.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "Alex's idea is to use events (hovering and clicking) to initiate instructions (display details or navigate to more detailed page). Option 2 perfectly aligns with this concept, making the system interactive. Other options are either not interactive, do not make use of events, or do not offer as comprehensive a user experience."
}
